Course Description: The course focuses on building the ability to analyze and design electronic circuits. This course starts with an overview of semiconductor technology. Subsequently it covers Bipolar Junction Transistor (BJT), Small Signal BJT models, BJT based amplifiers, Metal Oxide Field Effect Transistors (MOSFET), Small Signal MOS models, MOSFET based amplifiers; and analog and digital circuits and applications. Design and lab exercises are also significant components of the course.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Derive small signal model for BJT and MOSFET

Course Outcomes.CO2: Apply appropriate biasing techniques to BJT & MOSFETs

Course Outcomes.CO3: Apply single, multi-stage and power amplifier circuits
